articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy talks to Argentina, Chile presidents
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy pressed on with his campaign to obtain support from Latin America with calls Friday to the leaders of Argentina and Chile. “I continue to establish relations with an important region — Latin America,” Zelenskyy wrote on social media.
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentina exported $3.8 bln in farm products in June, record for the month -export chamber
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, July 1 (Reuters) - Argentine exports of grain, oilseeds and their derivatives totaled $3.82 billion in June, the country's CIARA-CEC chamber of oilseed crushers and export companies said on Friday, a record for the month since it started polling such figures.CIARA-CEC, which represents 48% of Argentina's exports, said $19.15 billion in accumulated agro-export

articles.title: Argentine wheat crop most delayed in a decade amid drought, exchange says
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, July 1 (Reuters) - Argentina's wheat crop for the 2022/23 season is the country's most delayed in a decade, as a period of drought and coming frosts force farmers to put planting off for better conditions, the Rosario Grains Exchange reported Thursday.The announcement came a day after the Buenos Aires Cereal Exchange said it could again cut its estimate of the

articles.title: Queen Shows Her Biting Sense of Humor in Resurfaced Soccer Clip
articles.description: When asked if she'd be watching the 1998 World Cup match between England and Argentina, the queen responded: "We're going to have a very difficult job I think."
articles.content:
Queen Elizabeth II's sense of humor has been praised after a video of the monarch responding to a question about a soccer match went viral on TikTok.

articles.title: Argentina truck snarl eases slightly, boosting grains flow to ports

articles.title: In Argentina, farm groups call for trade halt to protest government
articles.description: Earlier this month, the energy ministry announced higher required biodiesel content in diesel blends in a bid to address the shortage of the motor fuel. Nicolas Pino, head of Argentina's Rural Society, stressed the July 13 strike will not affect ordinary motorists, unlike recent truck driver protests that have caused major highway disruptions.
articles.content:
Argentina's major farm groups called for a trade strike in two weeks in a bid to pressure the government to do more as frustration over crippling shortages of diesel and fertilizers weighs on the country's key agricultural sector.
